docs.title: bolt.gives Documentation
docs.text: bolt.gives is a collaborative, open-source AI coding workspace.

docs.title: Platform Support (Important)
docs.text:
• Using bolt.gives in a browser: supported on Windows, macOS, and Linux (any modern browser).
  • Installing / self-hosting bolt.gives: supported on Ubuntu 18.04+ only.
  • Windows is not supported for installation/self-hosting (but you can use the hosted app from Windows).
  • macOS is not supported for installation/self-hosting (but you can use the hosted app from macOS).

docs.title: 1) Install Prerequisites
docs.text:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y git curl ca-certificates build-essential

docs.title: 2) Install Node.js (Recommended: Node 22 via nvm)
docs.text:
bolt.gives requires Node.js >= 18.18.0. For best results, use Node.js 22.

curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.7/install.sh | bash
# restart your shell, then:
export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"
nvm install 22
nvm use 22
node -v

docs.title: Clone + Install
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/embire2/bolt.gives.git
cd bolt.gives
pnpm install
cp .env.example .env.local

docs.title: Configure API Keys (No bolt.gives signup required)
docs.text:
bolt.gives does not require a bolt.gives account. To use LLMs, you configure your provider API keys:

  • Cloud providers (OpenAI/Anthropic/OpenRouter/etc.): you sign up with that provider to obtain an API key.
  • Local providers (Ollama/LM Studio/etc.): you run the provider locally and point bolt.gives at it.

You can configure keys in either of these ways:

  1. In-app settings (recommended):
  2. Open Settings
  3. Choose your provider
  4. Paste your API key
  5. .env.local:
  6. Add values to .env.local (never commit it)

docs.title: Build (High Memory)
docs.text:
This repo can require a larger Node heap during builds.

pnpm run build:highmem
pnpm run start

If you prefer the explicit environment variable:

NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=6142 pnpm run build

docs.title: Cloudflare Pages (Git Deploy)
docs.text:
If you deploy this repo via Cloudflare Pages:

  • Build output directory: build/client
  • If your build fails with out-of-memory: set NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=6142 in the Pages build environment

docs.title: Platform Support (Important)
docs.text:
• Installing / self-hosting bolt.gives for development is supported on Ubuntu 18.04+ only.
  • Windows is not supported for installation/self-hosting (but you can use the hosted app from Windows).
  • macOS is not supported for installation/self-hosting (but you can use the hosted app from macOS).

docs.title: Start Here
docs.text:
The canonical contribution guide lives in the repo root:

  • CONTRIBUTING.md

That file includes: - PR rules and validation gate (pnpm run typecheck, pnpm run lint, pnpm test) - Development setup steps - Issue reporting expectations

docs.title: Quick Dev Setup (Ubuntu 18.04+)
docs.text:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y git curl ca-certificates build-essential

Install Node.js (recommended: Node 22 via nvm):

curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.7/install.sh | bash
export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"
nvm install 22
nvm use 22

Enable pnpm (recommended: corepack):

corepack enable
corepack prepare pnpm@9.15.9 --activate

Run the app:

pnpm install
cp .env.example .env.local
pnpm run dev

docs.title: What platforms are supported?
docs.text:
• Using bolt.gives in a browser: supported on Windows, macOS, and Linux.
  • Installing / self-hosting bolt.gives: supported on Ubuntu 18.04+ only.
  • Windows is not supported for installation/self-hosting (but you can use the hosted app from Windows).
  • macOS is not supported for installation/self-hosting (but you can use the hosted app from macOS).

docs.title: Do I need a bolt.gives account to use it?
docs.text:
No. bolt.gives does not require a bolt.gives signup/account.

To use an LLM provider, you will typically need an account with that provider (OpenAI/Anthropic/OpenRouter/etc.) to obtain an API key.

docs.title: My first prompt fails with an API-key error. What do I do?
docs.text:
Configure an API key for the provider you selected:

  • In-app (recommended): open Settings, select the provider, paste the API key.
  • Or via .env.local (for self-hosting): copy .env.example to .env.local and fill in keys.

docs.title: My build fails with \"JavaScript heap out of memory\"
docs.text:
Use the high-memory build:

pnpm run build:highmem

Or:

NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=6142 pnpm run build

docs.title: Is Supabase required?
docs.text: No. Supabase is optional and is only needed for session save/resume/share features.
